definition: warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: South Africa Has Beautiful Scenery, Mild Climate , "Rainbow Country"Good Name.
sentences.chinese: 南非风景娟秀，天气温顺，有“彩虹之国”的美称。

sentences.english: This little blond moppet, gentle and kind and interested in the world.
sentences.chinese: 这个金发的小娃娃，温顺而友好，对世界充满了兴趣。

sentences.english: She has too mild a nature to get angry with me.
sentences.chinese: 她的性情太温顺了，不会对我发火的。

sentences.english: “The most temperate of the species is the Burmese python,” he said.
sentences.chinese: “所有种类中缅甸巨蟒最温顺，”他说。

sentences.english: In daily life, hao Beijing by Shanghai man's feeling fine and tame.
sentences.chinese: 在日常生活里，郝京妮感遭到上海男人的细腻和温顺。

sentences.english: But at the same time as mild as an Angora cat, a species which I prefer.
sentences.chinese: 同时又温顺如安哥拉小猫，我更喜欢这种猫。

sentences.english: As docile as she seems today, that lioness was once a ferocious beast.
sentences.chinese: 那母狮子原是只凶猛的野兽，今天牠却这般温顺。

sentences.english: Her temperament is in fact rather quiet, quiet and docile.
sentences.chinese: 她的性情实际上相当平和，平和而温顺。

sentences.english: In the pool, she must have been giddy with agreeability.
sentences.chinese: 泳池里的她肯定因为温顺而显得轻浮。

sentences.english: Mr. B didn't get the promotion because he was like a lamb to the slaughter.
sentences.chinese: 先生没有得到晋升，因为他是位温顺的大好人。

sentences.english: Giant pandas have very docile temperaments.
You will find the dog's tractability and friendliness.
sentences.chinese: 你会发现狗既温顺又友好。

sentences.english: They are also gentle, and may be trained to be good pets.
sentences.chinese: 它们也很温顺，可以训练为很好的玩赏动物。

sentences.english: They are good-natured, co-operative creatures, and they share their food tardily.
sentences.chinese: 它们看起来很可爱，性格温顺，合作，乐于分享食物。

definition: to do what one is told/obedient
to be good at understanding others (idiom)
(of a person's manner or character) gentle and quiet
